text: Answer is (C) A cycle of length 3 requires 3 vertices. Number of ways in which we can choose 3 vertices from 8 = 5C3 = 56. Probability that 3 vertices form a cycle = Probability of edge between vertices 1 and 2 x Probability of edge between vertices 2 and 3 x Probability of edge between vertices 1 and 3 o1 « 1 « 1 1 27272 8 1 So, expected number of cycles of length 3 = 56 X 3= 7 ref@ http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14801072/number-of-cycles-in-a-random-graph
